title: Regarding publishing controversial books in the U.S., why don't they just publish these books in another country and avoid all of the litigious bullshit of the United States? - Quora
tags: Laws in the United States of America
Politics of the United States of America

response.answer_text: Most of the noise is about the possibility of releasing confidential or secret info. Releasing such overseas could result in imprisonment for such. Understand though, these books do get released and all the noise and failed lawsuits only adds to the book sales.

I imagine foreign book publishers don’t have the US distribution and promotion resources and networks that US publishers do, so getting it in bookstores and getting it promoted becomes a far dicier proposition.
